alert.note: Alert for Cass; Sargent (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 14 at 2:12PM CDT until further notice by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast North Dakota and southeast North Dakota, including the following counties, in northeast North Dakota, Grand Forks. In southeast North Dakota, Barnes, Cass, Griggs, Ransom, Richland, Sargent, Steele and Traill. * WHEN...Until 200 PM CDT Friday Apr 21. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 207 PM CDT, emergency management reported snowmelt in the warned area. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. - Ongoing snowmelt will lead to widespread flooding impacts over the next week. This may include road closures, washouts, and other snowmelt related impacts.
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
